lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: What happened in the first plague?
answers: God turned Egypt’s water into blood
God sent hail to destroy the crops
God covered the land in darkness
God sent a great earthquake

questions.text: What happened in the second plague?
answers: God sent frogs to cover Egypt
God sent gnats to bite the people
God sent deadly snakes to bite the people
God caused the river to dry up

questions.text: What happened in the third plague?
answers: God turned dust into gnats that covered people and animals
God sent a bunch more frogs
God gave the Egyptians a tummy ache
God sent donkeys to eat the crops

questions.text: What happened in the fourth plague?
answers: God sent swarms of flies, but not where the Israelites lived
God sent flies on the Egyptians and the Israelites
God turned the moon to blood
God sent fire from the sky

questions.text: What happened in the fifth plague?
answers: God caused a deadly disease that killed the Egyptians' livestock
God caused the Egyptians to go blind
God turned the water into frogs
God made the pyramids fall down

questions.text: What happened in the sixth plague?
answers: God sent painful boils on the Egyptians and their animals
God caused the Egyptians to become deaf
God sent painful boils on the Egyptians and the Israelites
God made the sun stand still in the sky

questions.text: What happened in the seventh plague?
answers: God sent hail that destroyed crops and animals
God sent ladybugs to crawl over their faces
God sent frogs raining down from heaven
God turned the water into flies

questions.text: What happened in the eighth plague?
answers: God sent locusts to eat everything left after the hail
God sent boils on the frogs
God sent honeybees into the land
God made Pharaoh’s hair fall out

questions.text: What happened in the ninth plague?
answers: God caused darkness over Egypt for three days
God caused Pharaoh to die
God sent hail and thunder
God caused the river to flood

questions.text: What did these nine plagues teach the Egyptians about their gods?
answers: Their gods were powerless against the Lord
The Lord was a weak God
Their gods were away on vacation
Their gods needed more sacrifices
